content.question:
<math alttext="N H 3 aqueous plus H 2 O liquid is in equilibrium with N H 4 with a positive 1 charge aqueous plus O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous. K sub b equals 1.8 times 10 to the negative 5 power at 25 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>⇄</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>) </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mtext> </mtext><mtext>at</mtext><mtext> </mtext><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
The reaction between <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and water is represented above. A solution that is initially <math alttext="0.200 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> has a <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of 11.28. Which of the following correctly predicts the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a solution for which <math alttext="the initial molar concentration of N H 3 equals 0.100 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mtext>initial</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></math>, and why?

choices.label: The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be lower than 11.28 because decreasing the initial concentration of <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> increases the equilibrium concentration of the conjugate acid <math alttext="N H 4 with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be lower than 11.28 because the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions decreases when the initial concentration of the base decreases.

The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be higher than 11.28 because decreasing the initial concentration of <math alttext="N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases the equilibrium concentration of the conjugate acid <math alttext="N H 4 with a positive 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be higher than 11.28 because the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions increases when the initial concentration of the base decreases.

content.answer: The <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will be lower than 11.28 because the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="O H with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions decreases when the initial concentration of the base decreases.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
